CONTEXTE:
Nous sommes éudiants en graphisme et nous somme en période de projet
Nous avons du créer une animation qui explique les problemes du au cancer.
Cette animation serait destiné a des médecins qui montreraient l'animation pour expliquer comment fonctionne le cancer.
Ensuite, en anglais nous avons fait un faux projet kickstarter pour financer le projet, le materiel, le salaires, ect..
Maintenant nous devons reproduire le show "Jimmy Kimmel Live" avec une personne qui va jouer le role de Jimmy Kimmel, et trois personne qui vont jouer les roles des personnes de l'equipe d'animation : 
Benjamin -> Creation lead - Animator lead
Celestin -> Communication Head of the group - animator
Julie -> Creation lead artist - character designer - storyteller
Consigne :
écris moi un script d'emmission de 14 min avec le dialogue de chaque personnes
Il doit y avoir les phrases de chaques personnes.
Peux tu me poser des question pour mieux comprendre ce que tu dois faire, pour mieux comprendre le sujet et me générer un script mieux détaillé.
Je vais te demander d'ecrire 2 min de script puis je vais devoir te dire "suite" pour que tu continues jusqu'a atteindre environ 14 min de script.
Le script doit etre en anglais.

Exemples :
What inspired you to create a cartoon that explains genetic diseases, and specifically cancer, to children?
How did you come up with the idea for this project, and what steps have you taken to bring it to fruition?
What do you hope to accomplish with this cartoon, and who is your target audience?
Can you tell us about the challenges you have faced so far, and how you plan to overcome them?
How will you ensure that the information in your cartoon is accurate and accessible to children of all ages?
What kind of support have you received for your project so far, and how are you planning to fund it?
What impact do you hope your cartoon will have on children who are dealing with genetic diseases, and their families?
How do you plan to promote your cartoon, and what kind of distribution channels are you considering?
Can you tell us about any other projects or initiatives you have planned for the future, and how this project fits into your long-term goals?
Finally, what message would you like to share with our audience, and how can they get involved and support your project?
Alright guys, I gotta know - what makes your cartoon stand out from all the other educational content out there?
So, you're trying to explain genetic diseases to children. Sounds like a tough job! How are you planning to make it fun and engaging?
I gotta say, your project sounds like a real tearjerker. How are you going to handle the emotional aspects of discussing cancer with children?
I'm sure you're facing some pushback from people who think that cancer is too heavy a topic for kids. How are you responding to those critics?
Okay, okay, let's get real for a second. You're students trying to create a cartoon. What makes you think you can actually make a difference with this project?
I know firsthand how hard it is to fund creative projects. How are you planning to get people to open up their wallets for your cartoon?
You're talking about genetics and cancer, but those aren't exactly "kid-friendly" topics. How are you planning to get children interested in this material?
I'm sure you've done a lot of research on genetics and cancer. What's the most interesting thing you've learned so far?
Creating a cartoon is hard work! How are you balancing your studies and your project?
Alright, last question. What do you want the legacy of your cartoon to be?
Your cartoon sounds like it could be a real game-changer for kids who are struggling with genetic diseases. How do you see it helping them, specifically?
You're taking on a big responsibility with this project - explaining something as complex as genetics to children. What kind of research are you doing to make sure your information is accurate?
I'm sure parents are going to be grateful for a resource like your cartoon. What kind of feedback have you gotten from parents and educators so far?
It's so important to get kids interested in science from a young age. How do you think your cartoon will inspire children to learn more about genetics and biology?
You're not just making a cartoon - you're creating an educational tool that could have a real impact on children's lives. What kind of benefits do you see your project having for kids who are dealing with genetic diseases?
I'm sure your project is going to take a lot of hard work and dedication. What motivates you to keep going, even when things get tough?
Your cartoon sounds like it could be a valuable resource for schools and healthcare organizations. Have you thought about how you're going to make it accessible to those groups?
I can imagine that creating something that's both educational and entertaining is a big challenge. How are you planning to strike that balance?
Your cartoon is going to be tackling some heavy topics, but you're doing it in a way that's accessible to children. What kind of impact do you think that could have on kids who are dealing with genetic diseases?
I think it's so important to create resources that can help children understand complex topics. How do you think your cartoon could help break down some of the barriers that prevent kids from learning about science and genetics?
Jimmy Kimmel: "So you guys are students, not professionals in the field of animation or medicine. Are you concerned that your project might come off as amateur or not well-researched?"
"Our Kickstarter looks really promising. Can you tell us more about how much you need to raise and what the funds will be used for?"
"What challenges have you faced so far in creating this cartoon and how have you overcome them?"
"I'm sure a lot of people are interested in contributing to your project. Can you tell us more about the rewards you are offering to backers on Kickstarter?"
"How do you plan to measure the success of this project, and how will you ensure that the message is being received and understood by children?"
"I think it's great that you're enlisting the help of medical professionals. How are you working with them to ensure that your content is medically accurate and sensitive to the needs of those affected by cancer?"
"Can you give us a sneak peek into what the cartoon will be like? What kind of characters and storylines can we expect to see?"
"What's next for your team after this project? Do you have any other educational or creative endeavors in the pipeline?"

Hey folks, it's me, Jimmy Kimmel, and I'm excited to be here with Celestin, Julie, and Benjamin to talk about their animated series on cancer. So let's jump right in!
First off, I'm curious, what inspired you guys to take on such a heavy topic and create a show for kids?
Now, let's talk about the characters in your series. Who are they and how do they help explain the message about cancer to children?
Money talk time! How are you planning to use the funds from your Kickstarter campaign to finance this project? Our viewers would love to know.
It's great that you're creating something to help children understand such a complex disease. But how do you plan to reach your target audience with this show? Have you thought about distribution yet?
I think it's fantastic that you're using animation to educate children about cancer. But how do you think this show can actually make a difference in their lives?
Creating any project comes with its own set of challenges. What are some of the biggest obstacles you've faced so far in creating this series, and how have you overcome them?
Have you received any feedback from people who have seen your show? What have they said about it?
You've got a Kickstarter campaign running right now. How can our viewers contribute to your project and what kind of rewards can they expect?
What are your plans for the future once the show is completed and released? Are there any other topics you're interested in exploring through animation?
And last but not least, what message would you like to send to kids and families who could benefit from your show, and to anyone who wants to support your Kickstarter campaign?
